content: the size of the front cover in order to create the back cover with the ws facing you make a slip knot and join the yarn with a tight slip_stitch on the 20 th st see photo 6 half_double_crochet in the same st you just joined your yarn into half_double_crochet in the next 34 sts 35 photo 6 where to start the decrease row r 26 to 42 or even number repeat r2 and r3 until you reach the same width as the front cover part for example my front cover is made of 19 row so i will do 19 row including the decrease row do not fasten_off part2-seams once the work is done you should be left with a flat cross with two wide sides front and back cover and two thinner sides page cover attached at the center to the binding cover see photo 7 we will now join the four sides to create an open rectangular prism photo 7 front and back cover pages and binding cover 6 alice s wool works first seam with the ws facing out use stitch markers to join the page covers to the front and back covers since the number of sts on the page covers matches the number of row on the front and back covers each st should have its own st post or turning chain to be joined to don t worry too much about the st placements as long as you stay consistent on every side photo 8 joint each st of the pages cover to its own st post from the back cover with the yarn still attached to your work join the sides by working single_crochet in each st and st post once you reach the end of the back cover and the start of the page cover work single_crochet in a st post of every row of the page cover to connect with the front cover for example since my page cover is made of 4 row i will find one post of each row and work single_crochet in each one of them see photo 9 and 10 then continue with the seam on the other side of the sleeve fasten_off 7 alice s wool works photo 9 identify the st posts you want to photo 10 what it should look like after single_crochet place your single_crochet in are placed in one post of each row from the page cover photo 11 first seam completed ws out second seam repeat the steps of the first seam on the other side of your work to create the second seam part3-strings if you want your book to stay securely inside of its pouch you might want to add strings to close the opening we will make four strings their placement will vary depending on the size 8 alice s wool works of your work see picture 12 for reference and use stitch markers to mark where you want the strings to be placed photo 12
